column4: Enselic:now i have another problem.i have moved the files from the disk to my hardrive.but now i can't delete the files.in nautilus there is pivot symbol.what to do?...well nautilus crahes sometime t 5 files of this pics,somtimes at 20
Enselic:okay,i have started nautilus with root permission,and i'm able to delete the files.how can i always start nautlis with root permission?as default?
well you shouldn't use the root account all the time
put your files in the your home directory always
and install software and such as root only,dont use root for common computer work
then you must have accidentally moved them there with the root
stay away from using root, and you should be fine
for intsance, if you make a sudo make install and some files are copied to your home directory
then the "nromal" you will not be able to change those file
use nautilus as root (sudo nautilus in terminal), right click on the files, permissions, and set the permission as you want them
Right Click -> Properties -> Permissions I belive
It's probably because it wants to preview them, you can change that in Edit -> Preferences -> Previews
(I use the swedish version, so the names might be wrong)
